a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Value of 1 tonne of bismuth¹, in constant 1998 US$ per tonne.
Data source: USGS - Historical Statistics for Mineral and Material Commodities (2023)
Note: This data is adjusted for inflation.
1. Bismuth: Bismuth is a metal that is often paired with other metals to form alloys. It’s found in electronic components such as semiconductors, and
used in fuses and sprinkler systems. Bismuth compounds are also used in cosmetics and pharmaceuticals.
